resources.string: No data received yet!\nPlease configure a source first.
High contrast accessibility is active!\nPress here to go to settings.
Interval of requesting data from source.
Delay in seconds before requesting the data from cloud, because if takes some time until the data is present there.
Enable LibreLinkUp follower, if user and password are set.
On next interval a new login will be executed.
API Secret to access the data (optional).
Add your access token, if you need one (optional).
Border for very high glucose values.
Top value for the target range.
Bottom value for the target range.
Border for very low glucose values.
Minimum interval for showing notifications for a new value.\nAlarms will always show a notification.
Will only trigger notifications for alarms in their specific interval.\nVery low values will always show a notification.
Show the glucose value as current song for Android Auto.
Send glucodata broadcast for new values received from any source.
Choose receivers sending the glucodata broadcast to. A global broadcast will send to every app registering dynamically on the broadcast.
Forward glucose values to xDrip+. Select \'Libre (patched app)\' as source in xDrip+.
Choose receivers sending the patched libre broadcast to. A global broadcast will send to every app registering dynamically on the broadcast.
Send broadcast like xDrip+ is sending. For example to AAPS.
Choose receivers sending the xDrip+ broadcast to. A global broadcast will send to every app registering dynamically on the broadcast.
Switch this on to use delta values for 5 minute interval, otherwise 1 minute interval is used.
Color for very high and very low glucose values.
Color for high and low glucose values.
Color for glucose values in the target range.
Shows a permanent notification with the current trend arrow, glucose and delta value in the status bar.\nThis notification prevents Android stopping this app.
Style of the small status bar icon of the notification.
Bigger icon in the status bar. Please disable this setting, if the icon is to big and is cut off.
The will remove the content of the notification, to have only a small notification with the related icon.
Show a notification without content to have an additional icon in the status bar.
Style of the small status bar icon of the notification.
Show glucose, trend, delta, time and IOB/COB as floating widget.\nIf you hold and not move the widget for more than 5 seconds, it will disappear.
Change size of the floating widget
Use relative time instead of glucose timestamp for widgets.\nRelative time depends on the battery settings on your device and may not work correct.
Glucose, trend, delta, time and IOB/COB
Forward values to widbgjs widget for BangleJS.
Glucose, trend icon, delta and timestamp
Test Range complication with negative values (for trend-range support)

For using this app in Android Auto, you have to activate developer settings in Android Auto by clicking several times on the version. Then you have to enable \"Unknown sources\" in the developer settings menu.
If you are using GlucoDataHandler as source, these settings will be overwritten from GlucoDataHandler, so you do not have to change them here.
To use GlucoDataHandler for Android Auto, you have to install GlucoDataAuto from GitHub.\nPlease click here for more information and to download GlucoDataAuto.
Send glucose values and settings to GlucoDataAuto, if the phone is connected to Android Auto.
Foreground notification which prevent stopping the app while running in background.
Additional notification to show an extra icon in the statusbar.
Worker notification shown while running tasks in the background.
Foreground notification which prevent stopping the app while running in background.
Notification which is shown in Android Auto
Noise-Block active in xDrip+ Inter-app settings!\nPlease change it to \"Extremely noisy\"!

To receive values from Juggluco:
- open Juggluco
- go to "Settings"
- enable "Glucodata broadcast"
- enable "de.michelinside.glucodatahandler"

To receive values from Juggluco:
- open Juggluco
- go to "Settings"
- enable "Glucodata broadcast"
- enable "de.michelinside.glucodataauto"

To receive values from xDrip+:
- open xDrip+
- go to settings
- go to Inter-app settings
- enable "Broadcast locally"
- set "Noise Blocking" to "Send even Extremely noisy signals"
- enable \"Compatible Broadcast\" - check \"Identify receiver\" to be empty or if an entry already exists, add \"de.michelinside.glucodatahandler\" separated by a space
- enable \"Compatible Broadcast\"\n- check \"Identify receivers\" to be empty or add a new line with \"de.michelinside.glucodataauto\"

IMPORTANT: this is not the account used for the FreeStyle Libre App!
To activate LibreLinkUp follower:
- open your FreeStyle Libre App and select in the menu Share or Connected Apps
- activate LibreLinkUp connection
- install LibreLinkUp from Play Store
- setup your account and wait for the invitation
Receive also IOB and COB values from nightscout pebble endpoint.

The notification is mandatory for correct working application.\nStarting with Android 13 you can swipe this notification away. If you do not want the notification back, set the \"Status bar icon\" to \"App icon\" and enable \"Hide content\".

To receive values from AAPS:
- open AAPS app
- go to "Config Builder"
- enable "Samsung Tizen" or "Data Broadcaster"
"Enable WatchDrip+ communication (without graph).\nIMPORTANT: enable \"Enable service\" in WatchDrip+ after enabling this setting here!"
Interval when the notification shall reappear if there is no new value. (0 for never).
Style of the dummy media player icon/image.

For all time/interval related work, this app requires the permission for alarms & reminders.\nIt will not add or change any user reminders, it is only for internal scheduling.\nIf you press OK, you will forward to the permission setting to enable it for GlucoDataHandler.
Schedule exact alarm is disabled!!!\nGlucoDataHandler may not work correct!!!\nPress here to go direct to the permission setting.
If there is more then one patient connected to the libre account, please select the patient receiving the data for.
If you enable lockscreen wallpaper, the app replaces the wallpaper on lockscreen.
Vertical position of the glucose-trend image on lockscreen:\n0 is the top of the display\n100 is the botton of the display
Showing notifications is disabled!!!\nGlucoDataHandler may not work correct and can not show alarms!!!\nPress here to go direct to the permission setting.
Missing data! Please accept invitation in LibreLinkUp app first!
If your device supports colored status bar icons, you can also deactivate it to use a white item.
Minimum interval in minutes between notifications for this alarm type.\nInformation: there will only be a new notification after the time has elapsed, if the delta is negative.
Minimum interval in minutes between notifications for this alarm type.\nInformation: there will only be a new notification after the time has elapsed, if the delta is positive.
Time in minutes since the last glucose value has been received to trigger this notification. It will also re-appear in this interval.
Notifications are enabled for this alarm type.
Notifications are disabled for this alarm type.
Press here to trigger a notification after 3 seconds for this alarm type.
Press here to go to settings for notification channel for this alarm.\nThere you can change all related settings.
Press here, if you want to save the default alarm sound to a file on your phone.
Alarm notifications are active on phone.\nNote: alarms using alarm volume of the phone.
Alarm notifications are inactive on phone.
Enables full screen notification on lockscreen.\nThis may request an additional permission.

Please enable this setting, if you have problems with the fullscreen notification.\nOn some devices, this will cause the unlock screen, while the fullscreen notification is triggered.\nSo please do not enable it, if you do not have any problems.

This will force an alarm sound and vibration even if the phone is in silent or vibration mode. It will always stop the do not disturb mode!\nTo enable this setting, you may be asked for allowing this app to change the do not disturb mode.
Force vibration, even if the phone is in silent mode. It will always stop the do not disturb mode!\nTo enable this setting, you may be asked for allowing this app to change the do not disturb mode.
Force setting sound level for alarm sound.\n-1 for using default settings of phone.
Advanced alarm settings for fullscreen notification and sounds.
Alarm settings for glucose values starting from %1$s.
No alarm while wear is connected
There will be no alarm notification on phone, if the phone is connected to GlucoDataHandler on watch.
There will be an alarm notification on phone, even if the phone is connected to GlucoDataHandler on watch.
No alarm while Android Auto is connected
There will be no alarm notification on phone, if Android Auto is connected.
There will be an alarm notification on phone, even if Android Auto is connected.
If the alarm notification is not closed, the alarm will be triggered again after this interval in minutes up to 3 times.\n0 - no retrigger
Alarm if there is no new glucose value for %1$s minutes.
This notification will appear, if there is no new value for in an interval.
GlucoDataHandler needs notifications to execute tasks in the background and to show alarms.
Alarm notifications. Please do not change the settings, as the app provides sound and vibration for notifications intern.
Time in seconds before the sound is played.\nIt will vibrate the whole time, even if there is no sound selected.

To show alarms, GlucoDataHandler needs at least the alarm notification channel to be enabled.\nYou will be forwarded to the notification setting for this app.\nPlease enable alarm notification channel there.
Include settings in message to GlucoDataAuto.\nThis will overwrite the settings in GlucoDataAuto.

To receive values from GlucoDataHandler:
- open GlucoDataHandler
- go to settings
- enable "Forward to GlucoDataAuto"
- to use the same settings, enable "Include settings"
If you are using Android Auto notifications, very low alarms will always trigger a notification and this can not be deactivated or changed.

To receive IOB from Juggluco:
- open Juggluco
- go to "Settings"
- enable "IOB"
- go to "Web server"
- enable "Active"
- optional: enable "Local only"

To receive values from xDrip+:
- open xDrip+
- go to settings
- go to Inter-app settings
- enable "xDrip Web Service"
Press here to set nightscout settings to use the local web server to receive additional IOB values.
This will overwrite your current nightscout source settings to use local webservice on port 17580 to receive IOB values.\nAre you sure?
Alarm settings are only related to notifications on Android Auto and do not trigger any sound.
General settings, like the unit, time and delta settings.
Settings for glucose borders and the corresponding colors.
Settings for phone widgets and floating widget.
Settings to replace the lockscreen wallpaper.
Setting for GlucoDataAuto to use for Android Auto.
Settings to transfer glucose values to other applications.
To use GlucoDataHandler on Wear OS watches, please install it from Google Play Store on watch.
Press here to re-check the connection to Wear OS.\nYou can also trigger this check while pressing on the connection info on home screen (even in the Wear OS app).
WatchDrip+ supports several MiBand and Amazfit devices.\nTo get a whole list of supported devices and more information about configure WatchDrip+, please press here.
Vibrate only without notification is not working on each device!
Use volume of the alarm sound instead of ringtone sound.\nThis may be independent from vibration mode.
Activate this to force not playing any alarm sound, independent of any other alarm sound setting.
Delay before vibration and sound is playing first time.\nSometimes the notification from phone stops vibration immediately.
Color for no new glucose values.
No extra wear notification popup, while phone connected.\nThe vibration and sound will be triggered as configurated.
Select an action or application which should be executed while tapping on this item.
Please disable this setting, if the trend arrow is too big or cropped.
General settings for the user interface of this application.

Only enable it, if you are using a follower source and Android Auto notifications only.\nThis prevents Android from closing this app, while not connected to Android Auto, so the app can not recognize the Android Auto connection.\nInstead of enabling this setting, you can also open the app in Android Auto once, if you are connected.
Battery optimization is enabled!\nPress here to disable it.

If you are using a follower source, the app may not be started while connected to Android Auto, if you are using Android Auto Notifications only.\nTo make sure the app detects Android Auto connection you have to disable battery optimization.\nIf it still does not work, you can also enable foreground mode or you have to open the app in Android Auto once, if it is connected to Android Auto.
Android Auto is either a separate app or part of the system and can be accessed through the Android settings.\nTo activate GlucoDataAuto for Android Auto, you have to do the following steps:

- open Android Auto
- scroll down to the Version
- tap several times on the Version until a popup appears to "Allow development settings"
- press "OK"

- open Android Auto
- open in the 3-dot menu the "Developer settings"
- scroll down to "Unknown source"
- enable it

- open Android Auto
- scroll down to "Messaging"
- enable "Show message notifications"
- enable "Show first line of messages"

- open Android Auto
- scroll down to "Display"
- open "Customise launcher"
- enable "GlucoDataAuto"
If GlucoDataAuto is not available, please restart your phone.

Displays the values in large and colored text.\nOn some Samsung devices with Android 13 and higher, this may cause the app to crash due to a bug on Samsung\'s side.\nIf the problem occurs, this setting will be automatically disabled to ensure the app remains functional.
I am so sorry that the app crashed during execution!\nPlease send me the logs so I can analyze the error and try to fix it as soon as possible.\nThank you!
Enable Dexcom Share account. You need to set username and password before.
Username, E-Mail or phone number for login to your Dexcom Share account.\nIMPORTANT: if you are using phone number, it has to include the country code (e.g. +1 for US).
The settings \'%1$s\' is set, but the related permission is not granted! Press \"OK\" to be forwared the permission dialog or press \"Cancel\" to disable this setting.
Use xDrip+ Broadcast Service API to receive data (also IOB) from xDrip+.\nPlease activate \"Broadcast Service API\" in \"Inter-App settings\" in xDrip+ first!
Time in minutes after the value is handled as obsolete.\nAfter twice this time, the value is removed.
Applications on same device providing glucose values as internal broadcast message, like Juggluco, xDrip+, AAPS and so on.
Cloud services providing glucose values over the internet, like LibreLinkUp, Dexcom Share and Nightscout.
To receive values from Dexcom BYODA you have to enable broadcast to AAPS while building the app.
To receive values from Eversense, you have to use ESEL either in companion mode (reading notification) or connected to the patched Eversense app.\nFor more information about ESEL, press here.
To receive values from Dexcom BYODA you have to enable broadcast to xDrip+ while building the app.
Notifications are disabled! \nPress here to enable them.
Show glucose value in %s in the details.
Press here to check your Dexcom Share account data for your non-US account.
Press here to check your Dexcom Share account data for your US account.
Change size of the lockscreen data.
Press here to reset the wear-phone connection if it is not working as expected.\nIf the reset does not solve the problem, please restart your watch.
Connection is not working as expected! Please try to restart your watch.
Time in seconds to close the floating widget while pressing on the widget without moving it.\n0 for disable this setting.
No alarm notifications for this alarm during quiet hours.\nConfigure your preferred times to use this feature.
No alarm notifications for all alarms during quiet hours.\nConfigure your preferred times to use this feature.
Select the time you want your quiet hours to start.
Select the time you want your quiet hours to end.
Specify the days of the week on which quiet hours should start at the selected start time.
The app crashes because of the colored notification layout!\nIt has been disabled to prevent this crash.\nA phone restart usually fixes this.
Auto close alarm notification after sound and vibration has finished, but only after at least 30 seconds.\nIf retrigger is active, the notification will be closed, if there is no additional trigger.
Export or import settings and save logs.
Press here to export all settings to a file. \nIMPORTANT: this will only export changed settings! Settings with default values will not be part of the export.

Press here to import settings from a file.\nIMPORTANT: this will not re-create default settings, as there are not part of the export.\nIf you want to reset to default, delete the app data first and import afterwards.
Save logs from the phone to file.
Save logs from connected Wear OS watch to file.
Alarm if the glucose value is higher or equal to %1$s and the delta rises by at least +%2$s for %3$d consecutive readings.
Alarm if the glucose value is lower or equal to %1$s and the delta falls by at least -%2$s for %3$d consecutive readings.
Delta value when the alarm should be triggered.
Number of times the delta value must be reached consecutively.
Border for the rising/falling alarm.\nThe glucose value must be higher/lower to trigger the alarm.
Internal messages from this source will be handled.
Internal messages from this source will be ignored.
Open Integration and enable \"Share data with GWatch\"\nRemark: the DiaBox broadcast only contains the glucose value and no more information like trend!
Remark: the AAPS broadcast from BYODA doesn\'t seem to work with other apps. \nPlease use the xDrip+ broadcast in BYODA.
Get started with GDA on Android Auto
Text-to-speech (TTS) is not enabled.\nTo use this feature, enable TTS in Android Accessibility settings.\nOnce enabled, tap here to update.
Speak current value when playing.\nRequires Text-to-speech to be enabled.
Play an empty sound to bring the media player to the front of the split screen.
Speak new values in Android Auto, even when using another media player.
Set the interval for speaking new values in Android Auto.
The interval for receiving new glucose values is used as the duration for the progress bar in the media player.\nSetting the value to 0 disables the progress bar.
Enable alarm icon on main screen to toggle alarm state.

By enabling this, you automatically accept new Terms of Use to ensure continuous data reception. You won\'t be informed about new terms separately. If you want to read them, disable this setting and refer to the LibreLinkUp app in case of error 4.
GlucoDataHandler can automatically accept new Terms of Use for LibreLinkUp.\nPress OK to enable this feature, or Cancel to read and manually accept the terms in the LibreLinkUp app.
Error, please re-login to LibreLinkUp App and check for any steps to be done!
Error type %1$s, please re-login to LibreLinkUp App and check for any steps to be done!
New Terms of Use must be accepted. Enable automatic acceptance in LibreLinkUp source settings, or log in again to the LibreLinkUp app and accept the terms.

Incorrect username or password. Please verify your LibreLinkUp source settings. If needed, try logging in again or reinstalling the LibreLinkUp app and checking your account settings.\nPlease stop all other apps accessing the same account!
Last glucose reading on server from %1$s
No glucose readings found on server.
Please stop all other apps accessing the same account!
Send battery level to watch to show in complication and on main screen.
Set the minimum time (in minutes) between glucose measurements before sending a new update to the watch.\nAlarms and very low measurements will always be sent.
Set the minimum time (in minutes) between glucose measurements before sending a new update to the receivers.
The alarm will sound and vibrate repeatedly until you dismiss the notification or the set max alarm duration is reached.
Specify the maximum time (in minutes) the alarm will sound and vibrate. A value of 0 means the alarm will repeat indefinitely.
To enable sources, please set them up in the phone app first. Activate sources on your watch only if you don\'t receive the data on your phone yet.

This app was developed in my free time as a hobby project. Therefore, I cannot guarantee that all features will work flawlessly on every device. However, I am constantly working on improvements.\nIf you encounter any problems or have questions, please contact me directly before leaving a negative review. \nTo stay informed about important updates and bug fixes, you are welcome to join the Facebook group or the Google Groups.

To receive data from Dexcom Share servers:
In the Dexcom App:
 - Create a follower
 - Under "Connections," ensure "Share On" is displayed

In GlucoDataHandler:
 - Enter your Dexcom Clarity username and password 
 (if you use your phone number as your username, include your country code)
 - Check the setting for a US account
Important: It does not work with a follower account!
Information about Wear OS third-party watch faces.
This app does not provide a watch face, it provides several complications (the small round watch face parts), which can be used for watch faces supporting 3rd party complications.
Most watch manufacturers already provide watch faces that can be used with the GlucoDataHandler complication.\nFor example, most Samsung \"Info\" watch faces are compatible.

Pujie is a watch face creator app with a cloud library.
To find compatible watch faces, search the library for watch faces starting with "GDH_".
Note: Pujie is not compatible with Wear OS 5 devices.
Tap here to open the app in the Play Store.
Diabetic Masked Man creates third-party watch faces specifically designed for use with GlucoDataHandler.\nTap here to open his Play Store page.
GDC Watch Faces are designed for use with GlucoDataHandler.\nTap here to open the Play Store page.

Always send new glucose values to watch.
Disable this to prevent data updates on the watch while the watch screen is off to save battery.
Alarm values will always be sent to the watch.
IMPORTANT: The obsolete alarm is disabled on the watch when this setting is disabled!
This alarm will notify you even if snooze or the general quiet hours for all alarms are active, ensuring you are alerted to very low glucose levels.
If this error persists, try reinstalling the Libre App. This often resolves the issue.
Name of the user/patient, which should be shown in notification and during speaking.\nThis should be used, if you are using multiple variants of GlucoDataAuto, otherwise it could be empty.
Click here to go to the YouTube video that illustrates the setup of this source. Many thanks to Diabetic Masked Man for creating the videos.
Choose up to 3 snooze durations to display as buttons on the alarm notification.
Show IOB and COB values, if available.
Number of hours shown in the graph in complication and on main screen.\nUse 0 to disable graph.
Number of hours shown in the graph.\nUse 0 to disable graph.
Number of hours shown in the graph on widget.
Press here to remove all data from database.
If you press OK, all data from database will be removed!\nAre you sure?
Use internal trend calculation related to the last values.
Use trend provided by the source.\nIf no trend is available, the internal calculation is used.
Display glucose values on the Always-on Display
Show values on the AOD display.
Change size of the AOD data.
Vertical position of the glucose-trend image on AOD display:\n0 is the top of the display\n100 is the botton of the display
Show y- and x-Axis in the widget.
To receive the glucose value and IOB from notifications other apps, like Dexcom, CamAPS FX and Omnipod 5.
Select an application, from which the notification should be read.
Notification reader is enabled to parse values from notifications for specific applications.
Notification reader is disabled and no notification will be parsed.\nPlease specify at least one application first.
Regex to parse the value from text in notification.\nPlease only change, if you know, what you are doing or if you get an advice from the developer.

Some apps, like Dexcom updates their notifications quite often. To ignore these updates with the same value, enable the 5 minute interval.\nIf enabled, there will be only a new value every 5 minutes or if the value in the notification has changed.

To receive values from notifications of other apps, a permission to access the notifications is needed!\nThe notifcation must include either the glucose value or IOB as string.\nAs each notification has a different layout, it may not work with every app. In case of problems, please contact me with a screenshot of the notification and the logs.
Because of special behaviour of Dexcom notificiations, you must also enable the foreground notification of Dexcom.
